Posts.Content: Caeryn23 wrote: I had a MRI in March 2009. The left breast showed 1 area of clumped enhancement, and 1 area of segmental clumped enhancement. The MRI core biopsy of both areas were benign. They put 2 clips/tissue markers in.  My MRI from this month showed the same two enhancements (same locations) from March. The first area was a little larger than before. The recent mammogram showed clustered microcalcifications in the second area. If it is fibrocystic changes, would the same two areas still be there from 7 months ago? What would cause the recent changes? Thanks in advance.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: MRI question Caeryn23 paris1926

Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2009 05:40PM Caeryn23 wrote: The March MRI: "3 areas of potential DCIS, 2 on left, 1 on right."  ACR category 4. This month's MRI: "Continued close MRI followup is recommended...in 6 months." BI-RADS category 3. The mass on the right is not there anymore. Both MRI's also mention "persistent delayed phase."

Posts.Content: Caeryn23 wrote: I started having discharge around November 2012. My doctor thought it was an infection and gave me antibiotics. I still have discharge. It's somewhat thick, browinish, and clearish. It doesn't happen all the time. I also have swelling in that breast. Could it still be an infection or something else? Can they do a ductogram if I don't have discharge at the doctor's office? Thank you. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Nipple Discharge question Caeryn23 Caeryn23

Posts.Content: Caeryn23 wrote: I moved the topic here.  I had a biopsy last thursday. Two thngs the biopsy found were duct ectasia, and fibroadenomatoid changes. It also says there are "predominantly extensively sclerotic breast parenchmya with sparse scattered benign ducts and lobules." The gross description says, "the rubbery consistency of the tissue extends to all 6 inked margins." Are any of these proliferative changes? What does sclerotic mean? What does the margin part mean? Thank you. Log in to post a reply
